page.title: 02Farming In Norton Area.
page.content: {Animals. } The cattle are mainly Hereford/Friesian cross, being fattened in Mad Brook and River Worfe valleys. There were also some Large White/Landrace cross pigs. In the distance we saw some Suffolk sheep. When the cattle are put in the yards for the winter, the farmers feed them fodder beet, silage, beet pulp and beet nuts. Hereford/Friesian and Charolais cattle are kept. When they are heavy enough they are sold for beef. The small pigs are sold to make pork, bacon and sausages. The big pigs stay out in the field, with arks for shelter, and are fed on pig nuts. The sheep are bought in the summer and eat grass, but are given hay in winter. Some racehorses are kept at Sutton Maddock.
